goals.question: What is the distribution of airports by country?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of number of airports by country
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand which countries have the most and least number of airports. This information can be useful for airlines and airport management companies to identify potential markets and investment opportunities.

goals.question: What is the distribution of airports by type?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of number of airports by type
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the proportion of different types of airports such as small, medium, large, and heliports. This information can be useful for airport management companies to identify the types of airports that are in demand and plan their investments accordingly.

goals.question: What is the distribution of airports by elevation?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of airport elevations. This information can be useful for airlines to plan their flight routes and identify airports that may require special landing procedures due to high or low elevations.

goals.question: What is the distribution of airports by runway length?
goals.visualization: Box plot of airport runway length
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of runway lengths at different airports. This information can be useful for airlines to plan their flight routes and identify airports that may require longer or shorter runways based on the type of aircraft they operate.

goals.question: What is the distribution of airports by municipality?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the geographic distribution of airports across different municipalities. This information can be useful for airport management companies to identify potential markets and investment opportunities, as well as for airlines to plan their flight routes and identify airports that are closer to their target customers.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.groupby('iso_country').size().reset_index(name='counts')
    data = data.sort_values(by='counts', ascending=False)
    plt.bar(data['iso_country'], data['counts'])
    plt.title('What is the distribution of airports by country?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Country')
    plt.ylabel('Number of airports')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    airport_types = data['type'].value_counts()
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.pie(airport_types, labels=airport_types.index, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=90)
    ax.axis('equal')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of airports by type?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['elevation_ft'] = pd.to_numeric(data['elevation_ft'], errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['elevation_ft'])
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.hist(data['elevation_ft'], bins=50, color='blue', alpha=0.5)
    ax.axvline(data['elevation_ft'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label='Median Elevation: {:.2f}'.format(data['elevation_ft'].median()))
    ax.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of airports by elevation?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['runway_length_ft'] = pd.to_numeric(data['runway_length_ft'], errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['runway_length_ft'])
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.boxplot(data['runway_length_ft'], vert=False)
    ax.set_xlabel('Runway Length (ft)')
    ax.set_yticklabels([''])
    ax.axvline(data['runway_length_ft'].median(), color='red', label=f'Median: {data["runway_length_ft"].median():,.2f}')
    ax.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of airports by runway length?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.groupby('municipality').size().reset_index(name='counts')
    plt.bar(data['municipality'], data['counts'])
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of airports by municipality?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
